channel.title: BBC News - Europe
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Ukraine war: Putin says Russia does not reject peace talks
item.description: The Russian leader also sought to justify the arrest of critical voices, claiming they were harming the country from inside.

item.title: Moscow drone attack briefly shuts Vnukovo airport
item.description: Russian officials say one person has been injured after two drones crashed into offices

item.title: Europe fires: The Canadair water bombers battling Mediterranean blazes
item.description: The distinctive yellow planes and their pilots play a crucial role in rugged Mediterranean regions.

item.title: Wagner could pose as migrants to enter EU, PM Morawiecki warns
item.description: Some Russian mercenaries are near the city of Grodno, close to Poland and Lithuania, Mr Morawiecki says.

item.title: Dnipro: Russian missiles hit apartment block and security service building
item.description: Nine people are injured and the top floor of an apartment block is almost completely destroyed.

item.title: Russia's new tactic for cutting off Ukraine's grain
item.description: Russia has started targeting Ukraine's alternative routes for exporting its grain.

item.title: Melting Swiss glacier uncovers climber missing since 1986
item.description: The body was discovered earlier this month by hikers who spotted a boot emerging from the ice.

item.title: Elephant on the loose spotted outside supermarket in southern Italy
item.description: Local media reports the animal escaped from a circus but has since been returned.

item.title: Ancient 2,000-year-old Roman shipwreck found off coast of Italy
item.description: The cargo ship was found laden with hundreds of Roman pottery jars, most of which are intact.

item.title: Sweden's Quran burnings put freedom of expression law to test
item.description: The security service says Sweden's image has been harmed abroad and security at home has worsened.

item.title: Ukraine war: Kyiv claims success as southern fighting intensifies
item.description: Ukraine's armed forces say they are solidifying positions after an advance east of Zaporizhzhia.

item.title: Ministry of Defence accidentally emails ally of Russia
item.description: Defence officials say the emails did not contain information that could compromise operational security.

item.title: Prigozhin: Wagner boss spotted in Russia during Africa summit
item.description: Meanwhile at the summit, Vladimir Putin said Russia was ready to send free grain exports to Africa.

item.title: Watch: Russia’s invasion of Ukraine through music by BBC Russia editor
item.description: Steve Rosenberg has written a score to chart life in Russia since its full-scale invasion of Ukraine.

item.title: Are arsonists behind Italy's devastating wildfires?
item.description: Residents suspect most of the blazes blighting their stunning region are intentionally lit.

item.title: False claims that heatwave is bogus spread online
item.description: Weather forecasters wrongly accused of using misleading data to "drive fear".

item.title: Ukraine in maps: Tracking the war with Russia
item.description: Ukraine's counter-offensive appears to be intensifying along sections of the front line but Kyiv warns progress will remain slow.

item.title: Ukraine war: Western armour struggles against Russian defences
item.description: Russians use layers of mines to prevent Ukraine's advance on the southern front.

item.title: Greece fires in maps and satellite images show extent of damage
item.description: Maps, satellite images and before and after pictures show the extent of wildfires across Greece.

item.title: Russia-Africa summit: Putin seeks to extend influence
item.description: Russia's president is hosting a summit of African leaders in a bid to increase Moscow's influence.

item.title: Paris 2024 chief wants Olympics and Paralympics to be 'new model' of 'spectacular and sustainable'
item.description: Paris 2024 chief Tony Estanguet says he wants next year's event to be 'a new model' for staging the Olympics.

item.title: Sinéad O'Connor obituary: A talent beyond compare
item.description: The shaven-headed Irish singer's turbulent life often threatened to overwhelm her music.

item.title: Turkey mine protesters blasted with water cannon by riot police
item.description: They were protesting the felling of trees to make way for an expansion to a coal mine.

item.title: Italy: Drone spots suspected wildfire arsonist
item.description: A man is detained in Italy after he was seen at the scene of a wildfire in Calabria.

item.title: Greece wildfires trigger massive explosions at air force ammunition depot
item.description: The blasts happened at an air force depo as firefighters continue to tackle wildfires in Greece.

item.title: Why July is the 'world's hottest month'... in 61 seconds
item.description: With July "virtually certain" to be the warmest month on record, BBC Weather has this analysis.

item.title: Rhodes fires: View from Glystra beach
item.description: The BBC's Azadeh Moshiri has been to Glystra beach near Kiotari, one of the areas worst affected by wildfires.
